intro: Cuminoides obliqua, commonly known as the zigzag cumin, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and have a distinct, pungent flavor. Cuminoides obliqua thrives in temperate climates and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils.
